What is the purpose of the `resendwallettransactions` command in Verus?

The `resendwallettransactions` command is intended for testing purposes and is used to immediately re-broadcast unconfirmed wallet transactions to all peers. This command is not typically needed as the wallet code automatically re-broadcasts transactions periodically.

resendwallettransactions
Immediately re-broadcast unconfirmed wallet transactions to all peers.
Intended only for testing; the wallet code periodically re-broadcasts
automatically.
Returns array of transaction ids that were re-broadcast.
The `resendwallettransactions` command returns an array of transaction IDs that were re-broadcast.

resendwallettransactions
Immediately re-broadcast unconfirmed wallet transactions to all peers.
Intended only for testing; the wallet code periodically re-broadcasts
automatically.
Returns array of transaction ids that were re-broadcast.
When would I need to use the `resendwallettransactions` command?

You would typically only need to use the `resendwallettransactions` command in specific testing scenarios, as the wallet code automatically re-broadcasts unconfirmed transactions periodically. In most cases, you would not need to use this command.

resendwallettransactions
Immediately re-broadcast unconfirmed wallet transactions to all peers.
Intended only for testing; the wallet code periodically re-broadcasts
automatically.
Returns array of transaction ids that were re-broadcast.
